Sentencas: Lanthanum strontium manganite (LSM) is widely used in cathodes of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) because of its long-term stability and performance at higher operating temperatures (850-900 degrees C).
Titulo: Mn Valence Determination for Lanthanum Strontium Manganite Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Cathodes

Sentencas: The conductivity of LSM depends on the Mn valence, which in turn depends on the level of strontium doping, the ratio of (La+Sr) to Mn, and the operating environment of the cell (temperature and atmosphere).
Titulo: Mn Valence Determination for Lanthanum Strontium Manganite Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Cathodes

Sentencas: Consequently, determining Mn valences is a key issue in understanding the relationship between conductivity and operating conditions.
Titulo: Mn Valence Determination for Lanthanum Strontium Manganite Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Cathodes

Sentencas: Although the defect chemistry of LSM has been investigated extensively, this study is the first that compares new measurements of Mn valence from two direct, independent techniques: X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS) and electron energy loss spectroscopy (EELS).
Titulo: Mn Valence Determination for Lanthanum Strontium Manganite Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Cathodes

Sentencas: Furthermore, we have examined surfaces and interfaces of LSM in cathode-symmetric SOFCs, and XPS results from surfaces in LSM exposed to a range of atmospheres and temperatures.
Titulo: Mn Valence Determination for Lanthanum Strontium Manganite Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Cathodes
